clinical_study.brief_title: Scalp Nerve Block and Opioid Consumption in Brain Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Pre-incisional Anterior Scalp Block on Intraoperative Opioid Consumption in Adult Patients Undergoing Elective Craniotomy to Remove Tumor: A Prospective Randomized Controlled

brief_summary.textblock: Anterior scalp block with 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml. may reduce the intraoperative opioid consumption in neurosurgical patients who undergoing the supratentorial craniotomy compared to those who receive 0.9% normal saline solution (placebo).

detailed_description.textblock:
Anterior scalp block with 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml. may reduce the intraoperative opioid consumption in neurosurgical patients who undergoing the supratentorial craniotomy compared to those who receive 0.9% normal saline solution (placebo).
A Prospective Randomized Double Blind Control

primary_outcome.description: The overall intravenous fentanyl consumption (microgram/ kilogram) during the surgery. The decision to administer fentanyl is guided by the changes of blood pressure and/ or heart rate greater than 20% from baseline level.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 minutes after skull pin insertion
secondary_outcome.description: The maximal systolic blood pressure within the first 5 minutes after skull pin insertion will be recorded. The systolic blood pressure change from baseline will be calculated. The unit is mmHg.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 minutes after skull pin insertion
secondary_outcome.description: The maximal heart rate within the first 5 minutes after skull pin insertion will be recorded. The heart rate change from baseline level will be calculated. The unit is beats per minute.

other_outcome.time_frame: end of surgery, before transferring to the intensive care unit
other_outcome.description: The rate of immediate extubation before transferring to the intensive care unit (ICU) compared between patients who received 0.5% plain Marcaine and 0.9% normal saline solution.

arm_group.description: Anterior scalp block with 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml.
Anterior scalp block with 0.9% normal saline 20 ml.

intervention.description: Anterior scalp block will be done by using 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml.
Anterior scalp block will be done by using 0.9% normal saline 20 ml.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who have supratentorial brain tumor
2. Patients have been scheduled to undergo an elective craniotomy to remove tumor in any surgical position
3. Patients have been general anesthetized with endotracheal intubation and control ventilation
4. Patients who have provided consent for the participation in the research and for the use of their medical record in research
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant patients
2. Patients who have a history of local anesthetic allergy and/ or anaphylaxis
